reasoning: New game system requiring 5-8 files across spawn management, physics, and monster entities. Contained to single service with no external integrations. Phaser physics is well-documented and likely has patterns in existing codebase.

scope.notes: Spawn manager (1-2 files), monster entity classes or configurations (3 types), physics/trajectory calculations (1-2 files), difficulty/config data (1 file), game scene integration (1-2 existing files modified)

integrations.notes: Phaser.js is already a project dependency. Physics system is built into Phaser with extensive documentation. No external APIs or services required.

infrastructure.notes: Pure client-side game logic. Spawn rates and difficulty configs will be in-code or JSON files, not infrastructure-level configuration.

knowledge.notes: Phaser is a mature, well-documented game framework. Existing codebase likely has entity/game object patterns. Context phase will reveal existing physics and spawn patterns.

concerns: Physics tuning for satisfying trajectories requires iteration
Spawn rate balancing to avoid overwhelming player
Performance with many active monsters on screen
Integration with existing game loop timing
risk.notes: Main risks are gameplay feel and performance tuning, not technical complexity. No security or data integrity concerns for client-side game logic.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Game logic with spawn rates, physics calculations, and multiple entity types requires unit tests for spawn logic/difficulty progression and integration tests for physics behavior. No security implications for client-side game mechanics.
